questions.question: What is the full meaning of OOP?
Which programming approach gives computational capabilities to objects?
What does a class represent in Java?
options: A template or blueprint for objects
questions.answer: A template or blueprint for objects

questions.question: What is an object in OOP?
Which two major components make up a class?
What does an attribute represent in an object?
options: The state or properties of the object
questions.answer: The state or properties of the object

questions.question: What does a method represent in an object?
options: The behavior or action of the object
questions.answer: The behavior or action of the object

questions.question: In which year was Simula 67 developed?
Which language is considered the first pure OOP language?
Who developed C++?
What is the parent of Java?
Which keyword is used to define a class in Java?
What is encapsulation?
options: The process of hiding implementation details
The bundling of data and methods within an object
The ability to inherit from multiple classes
The creation of multiple methods with the same name
questions.answer: The bundling of data and methods within an object

questions.question: How does encapsulation improve modularity?
What is code reusability?
options: Writing code from scratch for every program
Using existing code in new programs without rewriting
Deleting old code to make space for new code
questions.answer: Using existing code in new programs without rewriting

questions.question: Which OOP concept enables code reuse?
What is inheritance?
options: Acquiring properties from a parent class
Creating multiple methods with the same name
questions.answer: Acquiring properties from a parent class

questions.question: What is polymorphism?
What is the function of constructors in Java?
What distinguishes a method from a constructor?
options: A method has a return type; constructor does not
A constructor has a return type; method does not
questions.answer: A method has a return type; constructor does not

questions.question: What is abstraction?
options: Hiding internal details and showing essential features
questions.answer: Hiding internal details and showing essential features

questions.question: What keyword is used to create an object in Java?
What is the result of executing 'Triangle t = new Triangle();'?
options: An object of class Triangle is created
questions.answer: An object of class Triangle is created

questions.question: What is method overloading?
options: Same method name, different parameter list
Same method name, same parameter list
Different method name, same parameter list
Different method name, different parameter list
questions.answer: Same method name, different parameter list

questions.question: What is method overriding?
options: Creating multiple methods with different names

questions.question: How do anonymous classes differ from regular classes?
options: They have names and are declared separately
They lack names and are declared inside methods
questions.answer: They lack names and are declared inside methods

questions.question: Which keyword is used for inheritance in Java?
Can Java support multiple inheritance?
What is used to simulate multiple inheritance in Java?
What is the purpose of the 'super' keyword?
options: To reference the superclass constructor or method
questions.answer: To reference the superclass constructor or method

questions.question: What is an inner class?
options: A class defined inside another class
A class that inherits from another class
A class that implements an interface
A class with only static methods
questions.answer: A class defined inside another class

questions.question: What are static nested classes?
options: Inner classes tied to an instance of the outer class
Inner classes not tied to an instance of the outer class
questions.answer: Inner classes not tied to an instance of the outer class

questions.question: What is the default access level of a class?
What is the return type of a method that doesn't return data?
What is a parameter list in a method?
options: List of input types and names used in a method
questions.answer: List of input types and names used in a method

What is the switch statement used for?
options: Multiple conditional checks based on a variable's value
questions.answer: Multiple conditional checks based on a variable's value

questions.question: What data types are valid in a switch expression?
What is the difference between 'while' and 'do-while' loops?
options: 'do-while' runs at least once, 'while' may not
'while' runs at least once, 'do-while' may not
questions.answer: 'do-while' runs at least once, 'while' may not

questions.question: Which loop guarantees at least one execution?
What is the control variable in a 'for' loop?
options: The variable used to control iteration
The variable that stores the result
The variable that counts total iterations
The variable that breaks the loop
questions.answer: The variable used to control iteration

options: Variables defined inside a class but outside methods
questions.answer: Variables defined inside a class but outside methods

questions.question: What happens if 'myTriangle.findArea();' is called?
options: It returns the area of the triangle
questions.answer: It returns the area of the triangle

questions.question: What are Java library classes?
What is the purpose of import statements?
What is a base class?
options: A subclass that inherits from another class
A superclass from which subclasses inherit
A class that can't be extended
A class with only static methods
questions.answer: A superclass from which subclasses inherit

questions.question: What is a subclass?
options: A class that inherits from a superclass
A class that can't be extended
A class with only private methods
A class that implements multiple interfaces
questions.answer: A class that inherits from a superclass

questions.question: What does the 'extends' keyword do?
What is the impact of assigning 't = myTriangle'?
What is the difference between procedural and object-oriented programming?
options: Procedural is object-based; OOP is step-by-step
Procedural is step-by-step; OOP is object-based
Procedural uses classes; OOP uses functions
questions.answer: Procedural is step-by-step; OOP is object-based

questions.question: What access level allows use across all packages?
How does abstraction differ from encapsulation?
options: Abstraction hides implementation; encapsulation hides data
Encapsulation hides implementation; abstraction hides data
Abstraction is about inheritance; encapsulation is about polymorphism
questions.answer: Abstraction hides implementation; encapsulation hides data

options: Returns a value to the calling method
questions.answer: Returns a value to the calling method

questions.question: What is the function of the main method in Java?

It is used to create objects
It is used to inherit classes
It is used to implement interfaces
questions.answer: It is the program's entry point

questions.question: What must be true for a while loop to continue?
options: The condition must evaluate to true
The condition must evaluate to false
The loop variable must be zero
The loop must have run at least once
questions.answer: The condition must evaluate to true
